message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a novel approach that uses an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) to enhance the performance of millimeter wave (mmW) networks. The approach involves using an intelligent reflector (IR) carried by the UAV to intelligently reflect mmW beamforming signals from a base station towards a mobile outdoor user, while harvesting energy from mmW signals to power the IR. The paper also proposes a reinforcement learning (RL) approach, based on Q-learning and neural networks, to model the propagation environment and optimize the location and reflection coefficient of the UAV-IR to maximize the downlink transmission capacity. 

Based on this description, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), as the paper deals with communication and networking using mmW signals. The paper also involves the use of a UAV and an intelligent reflector, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.RO (Robotics) sub-category. The use of RL and neural networks for optimization suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-categories.
